means: 神经质地摆弄手指或手

sentence.Network_en: Police investigating a £10 million car insurance fiddle arrested 16 people yesterday.
sentence.Network_cn: 调查涉及1,000万英镑的汽车保险诈骗案的警察昨天逮捕了16人。

sentence.Network_en: Two of them got out to fiddle around with the engine.
sentence.Network_cn: 其中两人下车鼓捣引擎。

sentence.Network_en: She hated the thought of playing second fiddle to Rose.
sentence.Network_cn: 想到要身居罗斯之下她就很郁闷。

...火烧罗马平民区，把罗马三分之二地方烧成焦土。据说，这场火是尼罗「市区重建」计划的第一步；又据说罗马焚烧的时候，尼罗望着火焰抱着小提琴（fiddle）弹起来。只是这个「弹琴」传说有些靠不住——历史学家指出，罗马焚烧的时候，尼罗不在城里；此外，当时还未有小.

jx.jx_en_mean: be concerned with relatively trivial matters while ignoring the serious or disastrous events going on around one
take a less important and subordinate role to someone or something in a way often considered demeaning

lj.lj_ly: she had to play second fiddle to the interests of her husband.
lj.lj_ls: 她不得不迁就她丈夫的喜好。

lj.lj_ly: fiddled away the morning with unnecessary tasks.
lj.lj_ls: 一早上的时间都浪费在不必要的工作上了

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fithele, denoting a violin or similar instrument (originally not an informal or depreciatory term), related to Dutch vedel and German Fiedel, based on Latin vitulari 'celebrate a festival, be joyful', perhaps from Vitula, the name of a Roman goddess of joy and victory. Compare with viol

encyclopedia.content: 菲德勒 小提琴一方面保留著其最初的民间“本色”，以fiddle的身份活跃在世俗音乐的生活之中。尽管在乐器的制作、材料和形状上来说，小提琴和fiddle几乎没有差别。但是，在音乐内容、音乐风格和演奏方法等方面，两者是完全不同的。fiddle属于民间乐器，原来主要流行于爱尔兰、苏格兰、英格兰等民间音乐中，随著英国开垦者来到了美洲新大陆，fiddle也随之进入了美国的民间音乐中。演奏民间音乐的fiddle没有像小提琴那样具有一整套练

entry.def: If you fiddle with an object, you keep moving it or touching it with your fingers.

example.ex: Harriet fiddled with a pen on the desk.
example.tran: 哈丽雅特摆弄着桌上的钢笔。

entry.tran: 作小改动;略微变动;稍稍修改
entry.def: If you fiddle with something, you change it in minor ways.

example.ex: She told Whistler that his portrait of her was finished and to stop fiddling with it.
example.tran: 她告诉惠斯勒他给她画的肖像已经完成，不要再改了。

entry.def: If you fiddle with a machine, you adjust it.

example.ex: He turned on the radio and fiddled with the knob until he got a talk show.
example.tran: 他打开收音机，拨动旋钮，直至调到一个脱口秀节目。

entry.def: If someone fiddles financial documents, they alter them dishonestly so that they get money for themselves.

example.tran: 不要再在开支账户上动手脚了。

entry.def: A fiddle is a dishonest action or scheme in which someone gets money for themselves.

example.ex: Police investigating a £10 million car insurance fiddle arrested 16 people yesterday.
example.tran: 调查涉及 1,000 万英镑的汽车保险诈骗案的警察昨天逮捕了 16 人。

example.ex: ...legitimate businesses that act as covers for tax fiddles.
example.tran: 为骗税打掩护的合法企业

entry.def: If something is a fiddle, it is quite difficult to do because it involves small or complicated objects.

example.ex: I found out how to fix the tray on — a bit of a fiddle.
example.tran: 我知道该怎么把这盘子固定住了——有点麻烦。

entry.tran: (尤指用于演奏民间音乐的)小提琴
entry.def: Some people call violins fiddles, especially when they are used to play folk music.

example.ex: Hardy as a young man played the fiddle at local dances.
example.tran: 哈迪年轻时在当地舞会上演奏小提琴。

entry.def: Someone who is as fit as a fiddle is very healthy and full of energy.

example.ex: I'm as fit as a fiddle — with energy to spare.

entry.def: If someone is on the fiddle, they get money by doing illegal or dishonest things.

entry.tran: 大难临头仍歌舞升平;见危难而若无其事
entry.def: If you say that someone is fiddling while Rome burns, you mean that they are not dealing with a difficult or dangerous situation but instead are doing useless things or pretending that nothing is wrong.

entry.tran: 处于次要地位;当副手;唱配角
entry.def: If you play second fiddle to someone, your position is less important than theirs in something that you are doing together.

example.ex: She hated the thought of playing second fiddle to Rose.
example.tran: 想到要身居罗斯之下她就很郁闷。

entry.def: If you fiddle around or fiddle about with a machine, you do things to it to try and make it work.

example.ex: Two of them got out to fiddle around with the engine.
example.tran: 其中两人下车鼓捣引擎。

entry.tran: 虚度光阴;无所事事;瞎混
entry.def: If someone fiddles around or fiddles about, they waste time doing unimportant things instead of dealing with important problems.

example.ex: He wants lawmakers to basically stop fiddling around as the country moves closer to breaking up...
example.tran: 国家在日益走向分裂，他希望立法者们再不要无所事事了。

example.ex: He wastes time fiddling about with minor matters.
example.tran: 他把时间都浪费在鸡毛蒜皮的小事上。

entry.def: If you say that someone is fiddling around with or fiddling about with something, you mean that they are changing it in a way that you disapprove of.

example.ex: Right now in Congress, they're fiddling around with the budget and so on...
example.tran: 此时在国会，他们正就预算案等等瞎折腾。

example.ex: One always wonders when a man starts fiddling about with his Will.
example.tran: 一个人开始把遗嘱改来改去时总让人感到诧异。

means.word_mean: 1. bowed stringed instrument that is the highest member of the violin family; this instrument has four strings and a hollow body and an unfretted fingerboard and is played with a bow
2. commit fraud and steal from one's employer;

sentences.sentence: "We found out that she had been fiddling for years"

means.word_mean: 5. manipulate manually or in one's mind or imagination;

sentences.sentence: "She played nervously with her wedding ring"
"He played with the idea of running for the Senate"

means.word_mean: 6. play around with or alter or falsify, usually secretively or dishonestly;

sentences.sentence: "Someone tampered with the documents on my desk"
"Can you tinker with the T.V. set--it's not working right"
"She always fiddles with her van on the weekend"

auth_sentence.content: Ellika Frisell is queen of traditional Swedish fiddle playing.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ellika Frisell is queen of traditional Swedish fiddle playing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ellika Frisell is queen of traditional Swedish fiddle playing.

auth_sentence.content: On record, Pacheco is firmly confined to second fiddle.
auth_sentence.res_content: On record, Pacheco is firmly confined to second fiddle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On record, Pacheco is firmly confined to second fiddle.

auth_sentence.content: That part of the economy has always played second fiddle.
auth_sentence.res_content: That part of the economy has always played second fiddle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That part of the economy has always played second fiddle.

sentences.en: He is above meanness and fiddle.
sentences.cn: 他不至于搞卑鄙和欺骗行为。

jushi.english: She plays the fiddle in the school band.
jushi.chinese: 她在学校乐队里拉小提琴。

jushi.english: It's a fiddle—they put different labels on the bottles and sell them at three times the proper price.
jushi.chinese: 这是一种欺诈行为——他们给这些瓶子贴上不同的标签，以三倍于通常的价格出售。

jushi.english: She fiddled with her earrings as she talked.
jushi.chinese: 她说话的时候拨弄着她的耳环。
